milestone_details: Day 1 period marks the start of a new cycle.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi:
Progesterone and estrogen levels drop, triggering the uterine lining to shed. 
By around day 5, FSH and estrogen begin to rise, promoting follicle growth in the ovaries and rebuilding the endometrium
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: During early follicular days 1-5, low hormones often bring fatigue, cramps, bloating, and low or irritable moods, though energy may start lifting by day 5 as estrogen rises.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritise rest, gentle movement like walking or yoga, warm compresses for cramps, iron-rich foods to counter blood loss, and hydration to ease bloating and fatigue.

milestone_details: Blood test to check baseline hormones to prepare for stims.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Baseline IVF blood test measures FSH, estradiol, LH, and progesterone to confirm cycle start before launching stimulation injections.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel typical early period symptoms like cramps or fatigue, plus brief arm soreness from the blood draw, with no major shifts yet.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritise rest, gentle movement, iron-rich foods to counter blood loss, and hydration to ease bloating and fatigue. Prepare any questions for your clinic ahead of stim protocol.

milestone_details: Start stimulation medication
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Daily FSH/LH injections work to recruit multiple ovarian follicles to grow mature eggs for IVF retrieval.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel bloating, mild ovarian tenderness, or fatigue as follicles enlarge, with energy still low from early cycle but mood lifting soon.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritize light walks, high-protein meals, hydration to counter bloating, and attend monitoring scans while avoiding alcohol and caffeine excess.

milestone_details: Blood test checks hormone levels to track stim medication and rising estradiol and LH.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Multiple follicles grow under FSH stimulation, ovaries enlarge slightly, and estrogen surges to prepare eggs and thicken the uterine lining
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel increasing bloating, ovarian fullness or tenderness, mood swings from high estrogen, and fatigue, with possible headaches or breast sensitivity.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Attend bloods rested and hydrated for clear images, track symptoms, and continue high-protein hydration to manage side effects.

milestone_details:
A transvaginal probe is used to measure follicle sizes, count developing eggs, and check endometrial thickness for optimal timing.
​
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Follicles grow under FSH meds, ovaries enlarge slightly, and rising estrogen prepares multiple eggs while thickening the uterine lining
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel increasing bloating, ovarian fullness or tenderness, mood swings from high estrogen, and fatigue, with possible headaches or breast sensitivity.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Attend scan with an empty bladder for comfort, wear loose clothes, track any spotting or pain, and hydrate well.

milestone_details: Antagonist injections are introduced to block premature LH surges, preventing early ovulation while follicles continue maturing.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Follicles continue growing under FSH stimulation while the antagonist suppresses LH to prevent premature ovulation.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may notice slightly more bloating or injection site reactions alongside ongoing ovarian fullness and rising estrogen effects like mood swings or breast tenderness.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Stick to your injection schedule precisely maintain high-protein hydration, attend scans as scheduled, and report severe symptoms like intense pain to your clinic promptly.

milestone_details: Trigger injection ensures ovulation occurs at the right time.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Trigger shot mimics the natural LH surge, prompting the ovaries to finalise egg maturation and detach the egg from the follicle wall about 36 hours later.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may notice slightly more bloating or injection site reactions alongside ongoing ovarian fullness and rising estrogen effects like mood swings or breast tenderness.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Rest post-injection, plan for retrieval, stay hydrated with electrolytes to prevent OHSS.

milestone_details: Egg retrieval uses a needle guided by ultrasound to aspirate mature eggs from ovarian follicles under light sedation.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Ovaries are at peak size with eggs collected for lab fertilization, while the body begins corpus luteum formation and rising progesterone.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel groggy post-sedation, bloated or crampy from ovarian fullness, with possible spotting, nausea, or fatigue from OHSS risk
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Rest fully that day with a support person, avoid driving or lifting, stay hydrated with light meals, and watch for severe pain or shortness of breath to contact your clinic.

milestone_details: Embryo is placed into your uterus.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Once implanted the embryo will attempt to burrow or attach to the lining. If attached, hCG will start to rise from day 9-10 post transfer.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel bloated, crampy, or fatigued from meds and the procedure, with possible light spotting, breast tenderness, or mild anxiety,
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritise bed rest post-transfer, gentle walks only, progesterone-friendly foods (magnesium-rich like nuts and greens), hydration, and avoid heavy lifting while following your clinic's two-week wait guidance.

milestone_details: Embryos are frozen using vitrification (flash-freezing with cryoprotectants) preserving them for future transfer.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: In the lab, quality embryos are selected, water removed from cells, and they're rapidly cooled for long-term storage while your body recovers post-retrieval with dropping estrogen.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may still feel bloated, crampy, or fatigued from meds and the procedure.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Rest and hydrate during recovery, avoid strenuous activity for a few days, eat anti-inflammatory foods, and discuss storage/transfer plans with your clinic.

milestone_details: Checks hCG levels to see if the embryo implanted successfully.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: If attached, hCG will start to rise from day 9-10, signaling the body to sustain the pregnancy.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may still feel bloated, crampy, or fatigued from meds and the procedure.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritise bed rest post-transfer, gentle walks only, progesterone-friendly foods (magnesium-rich like nuts and greens), hydration, and avoid heavy lifting while following your clinic's two-week wait guidance.

milestone_details: Day 1 period marks the start of a new cycle.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Progesterone and estrogen levels drop, triggering the uterine lining to shed. By around day 5, FSH and estrogen begin to rise, promoting follicle growth in the ovaries and rebuilding the endometrium
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: During early follicular days 1-5, low hormones often bring fatigue, cramps, bloating, and low or irritable moods, though energy may start lifting by day 5 as estrogen rises.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritise rest, gentle movement like walking or yoga, warm compresses for cramps, iron-rich foods to counter blood loss, and hydration to ease bloating and fatigue.

milestone_details: Blood checks hormone levels for timed insemination.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Baseline blood test on day 2-3 checks FSH, estradiol, LH and progesterone. ​
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel typical early period symptoms like cramps or fatigue, plus mild ultrasound discomfort, with no major changes yet from the pending meds.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritise rest, gentle movement like walking or yoga, warm compresses for cramps, iron-rich foods to counter blood loss, and hydration to ease bloating and fatigue.

milestone_details: Ovaries stimulated if prescribed.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Stimulation meds start to support ovarian follicles to grow mature egg for timed insemination.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel bloating, mild ovarian tenderness, or fatigue as follicles enlarge, with energy still low from early cycle but mood lifting soon.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritize light walks, high-protein meals, hydration to counter bloating, and attend monitoring scans while avoiding alcohol and caffeine excess.

milestone_details: Blood test checks hormone levels.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Estrogen starts to surge as the dominant follicle matures and prepares to release an egg.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel energized and optimistic, with libido often at its highest, clearer skin, and peak stamina, though some notice ovulation twinges or mild bloating.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritise workouts, social activities, nutrient-dense meals with healthy fats. Monitor your cervical mucus for ovulation.

milestone_details: Ultrasound checks lining and follicle growth.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Estrogen starts to surge as the dominant follicle matures and prepares to release an egg.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel energized and optimistic, with libido often at its highest, clearer skin, and peak stamina, though some notice ovulation twinges or mild bloating.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritise workouts, social activities, nutrient-dense meals with healthy fats. Monitor your cervical mucus for ovulation.

milestone_details: Trigger injection ensures ovulation occurs at the right time.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Trigger shot mimics the natural LH surge, prompting the ovaries to finalise egg maturation and detach the egg from the follicle wall about 36 hours later.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel a mild one-sided twinges from the follicle release or some brief spotting or bloating.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Embrace high-intensity exercise if it feels good, focus on antioxidant-rich foods.

milestone_details: Prepared sperm is placed into uterus to meet egg.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Prepared sperm directly into the uterus around ovulation, giving them a head start to reach and fertilize the egg in the fallopian tube
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel mild cramping or spotting from the catheter, some notice bloating or procedure-related tenderness.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Rest for the afternoon post-IUI, time intercourse around 1-2 days after if advised, focus on light exercise and fertility-supporting foods like antioxidants.

milestone_details: Progesterone supports the uterine lining.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Progesterone support starts as the corpus luteum forms post-ovulation (or trigger), supplementing natural progesterone to maintain and thicken the endometrium for potential implantation
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel calmer or more fatigued with possible bloating, breast tenderness, or mild mood shifts from rising progesterone,
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritise gentle exercise like yoga, progesterone-friendly foods (magnesium-rich like nuts and greens), adequate rest, and follow clinic dosing/timing while avoiding high-impact activities if sensitive.

milestone_details: Checks hCG levels to see if the embryo implanted successfully.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: If attached, hCG will start to rise from day 9-10, signaling the body to sustain the pregnancy.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel bloated, crampy, or fatigued from meds and the procedure, with possible light spotting, breast tenderness, or mild anxiety,
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Prioritise bed rest post-transfer, gentle walks only, progesterone-friendly foods (magnesium-rich like nuts and greens), hydration, and avoid heavy lifting while following your clinic's two-week wait guidance.

milestone_details: Ovulation is detected and egg is released or triggered.
personalised insights (dashboard) - medi: Your egg is releasing (or ready with trigger) as the mature follicle ruptures, while LH surges and progesterone begins rising to support the new corpus luteum.
personalised insights (dashboard) what_t: You may feel a mild one-sided twinges from the follicle release or some brief spotting or bloating.
personalised insights (dashboard) todays: Embrace high-intensity exercise if it feels good, focus on antioxidant-rich foods.
